name: Naiot Venture Accelerator
overview:
Naiot is a Venture Accelerator that helps entrepreneurs to translate innovative ideas into commercially-viable businesses. They provide incubation programs to nurture and grow new businesses, offering expertise, guidance and support throughout all phases.

Committed to entrepreneurial spirit, they serve as a highway between very early stage projects and venture capitals. They build relationships based on mutual trust and respect, and are willing to take higher development risk to enable the true opportunity that innovation deserves.

A subsidiary of Ofer Hi-Tech Group, Naiot makes 4-5 investments annually of up to $1M. Their business is nurturing IT and life science ventures by identifying, investing and developing evolutionary and revolutionary world-class technologies.

Naiot, positioned as a preferred partner among entrepreneurs, provides its portfolio companies support which spans the entire start-up development process, including support in product definition & development, developing a robust IP Strategy, defining a regulation path and above all â€“ leading the process of securing series A financing.

Since their establishment in 1997, they have launched over 60 companies, which have raised over $350 million in funding.

milestones.description: Naiot Venture Accelerator invests in Medical Devices Company: PhotoPill
Google acquires Naiot Venture Accelerator Portfolio Graduate MentorWave (Quiksee) for $10M
milestones.source_description: Google buying second Israeli startup: Quiksee
